intro: Ficaria ficaria, commonly known as the snowball plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, white, waxy flowers that resemble snowballs, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-draining soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Ficaria ficaria is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
